inlineContent.text: The class exposes the functions to Objective-C, and its main purpose is to be used in app framework bridges.
Certain features of the SDK might require prior user identification before being called, make sure you have triggered
the appropriate identification method before calling the features.

abstract.text: An interoperability object used as an entry point to the DevRev SDK.
An optional in-app link handler, which can be used to intercept and handle in-app links.
Registers the device token as provided by Apple for receiving push notifications from DevRev.
Creates a new support conversation over the top most view controller.
Manually tracks a screen name for identification.
A flag denoting whether the on-demand sessions are enabled.
Unmark the passed views as being sensitive.
Sets a flag that resumes the session monitoring.
Stops an ongoing user recording sessions and uploads the session to the portal.
A flag denoting whether the user has been has been provided to the SDK.
A flag controlling whether modals are dismissed when opening a link.
Unregisters the device from receiving push notifications from DevRev.
Identifies an anonymous user after the SDK has been configured.
Identifies a verified user after the SDK has been configured.
Presents the support feature modally over the top most view controller.
Starts a timer at any point in the app in order to measure time metrics for events such as load or response time.
A flag denoting whether the session is being recorded.
Ends a previously started timer.
A flag denoting whether the SDK has been configured.
Stops the ongoing user recording and sends all on-demand sessions along with the current recording.
Logs out the current identified user and resets the session.
The process will also unregister the userâ€™s device from receiving push notifications, and stop any ongoing
session recording.
Sets a flag that stops all session monitoring.
Clears the session properties.
Adds properties to the session. The properties will be sent along any analytic events.
Tracks an event described with a name and optional property payload.
Updates the properties of the current user.
Processes the push notification JSON payload and performs the necessary actions.
Pauses the ongoing user recording session.
Processes the push notification and performs the necessary actions.
Registers the processed device token string for receiving push notifications from DevRev.
A flag denoting whether session monitoring is enabled.
Configures the SDK with the app ID.
Identifies an unverified user after the SDK has been configured.
Starts a user recording session.
A flag to use the default theme for the support feature.
Mark the passed views as sensitive.
Pushes the support feature to your navigation stack.
An interoperability object used as an entry point to the DevRev SDK.
Resumes a paused recording session.
Presents the support feature modally.
